questions.question: What is a set?
questions.option_a: A. A list of random numbers.
questions.option_b: B. A collection of unordered objects.
questions.option_c: C. Any well-defined collection of objects.
questions.option_d: D. A group of integers only.
questions.explanation: A set is any well-defined collection of objects.

questions.question: What symbol denotes membership in a set?
questions.explanation: The symbol ∈ denotes that an element belongs to a set.

questions.question: Which of the following represents an empty set?
questions.option_b: B. Ø
questions.option_c: C. Both A and B
questions.explanation: Both {} and Ø denote the empty set.

questions.question: What is the universal set?
questions.option_a: A. A set that contains no elements.
questions.option_b: B. A set with only one element.
questions.option_c: C. The set of all elements under consideration.
questions.option_d: D. The set of natural numbers.
questions.explanation: The universal set contains all elements under consideration.

questions.question: What does A ⊆ B mean?
questions.option_a: A. A and B are equal sets.
questions.option_b: B. A is unrelated to B.
questions.option_c: C. Every element of A is also in B.
questions.option_d: D. B is a subset of A.
questions.explanation: A ⊆ B means A is a subset of B — all elements of A are in B.

questions.question: What defines a proper subset?
questions.option_a: A. A subset equal to its parent set.
questions.option_b: B. A set with elements not in the parent set.
questions.option_c: C. A subset with at least one fewer element than the parent set.
questions.option_d: D. A subset with exactly one element.
questions.explanation: A proper subset has all its elements in the parent set but does not contain all of them.

questions.question: What is the intersection of sets A and B?
questions.option_a: A. The union of A and B.
questions.option_b: B. The complement of A.
questions.option_c: C. The elements in A and not in B.
questions.option_d: D. Elements that are in both A and B.
questions.explanation: Intersection includes only the common elements in both sets.

questions.question: What is the union of sets A and B?
questions.option_a: A. Elements in A only.
questions.option_b: B. Elements in B only.
questions.option_c: C. Elements in either A or B or both.
questions.option_d: D. Only elements common to both.
questions.explanation: Union combines all elements from both sets without duplication.

questions.question: What is the complement of set A?
questions.option_a: A. Elements in A only.
questions.option_b: B. Elements not in A.
questions.option_c: C. Elements in both A and B.
questions.option_d: D. Elements in the empty set.
questions.explanation: The complement of A includes all elements not in A but in the universal set.

questions.question: What is the set difference A − B?
questions.option_a: A. Elements in B but not in A.
questions.option_b: B. Elements in both A and B.
questions.option_c: C. Elements in A but not in B.
questions.explanation: A − B includes elements in A that are not in B.

questions.question: What are disjoint sets?
questions.option_a: A. Sets with all elements common.
questions.option_b: B. Sets with no elements in common.
questions.option_c: C. Sets that are equal.
questions.explanation: Disjoint sets have no elements in common.

questions.question: What is the Cartesian product of sets A and B?
questions.option_a: A. Union of A and B.
questions.option_b: B. All possible sums of elements from A and B.
questions.option_c: C. Set of all ordered pairs (a, b) with a ∈ A and b ∈ B.
questions.option_d: D. Intersection of A and B.
questions.explanation: The Cartesian product A × B is the set of all ordered pairs from A and B.

questions.question: What is a power set?
questions.option_a: A. A set of all even elements.
questions.option_b: B. A set of all prime subsets.
questions.option_c: C. A set of all subsets of a set.
questions.option_d: D. A set with maximum elements.
questions.explanation: The power set of a set A is the set of all subsets of A.

questions.question: How many elements does the power set of a 3-element set have?
questions.explanation: A set with n elements has 2^n subsets. For n = 3, it has 8.

questions.question: What is a function in mathematics?
questions.option_a: A. A relationship where one input maps to multiple outputs.
questions.option_b: B. A relationship where each input maps to exactly one output.
questions.option_c: C. A collection of random values.
questions.explanation: A function relates each input to exactly one output.

questions.question: What is the range of a function?
questions.option_a: A. Set of inputs.
questions.option_b: B. Set of all outputs.
questions.option_c: C. The domain.
questions.explanation: The range is the set of values the function can output.

questions.question: When are two functions equal?
questions.option_a: A. When they have same name.
questions.option_b: B. When they have same domain and range only.
questions.option_c: C. When they have the same domain, codomain, and output for each input.
questions.explanation: Two functions are equal when they give same output for all inputs and have the same domain and codomain.

questions.question: What defines a one-to-one function?
questions.option_a: A. Each input maps to many outputs.
questions.option_b: B. Each output comes from a unique input.
questions.option_c: C. Multiple inputs share the same output.
questions.option_d: D. Only one element in the domain.
questions.explanation: One-to-one functions ensure that each output is mapped from one unique input.

questions.question: What defines an onto function?
questions.option_a: A. Only some outputs are used.
questions.option_b: B. Every element of the codomain is an output of the function.
questions.option_c: C. Each input maps to multiple outputs.
questions.option_d: D. Only domain elements are used.
questions.explanation: An onto function maps inputs such that every element in the codomain is covered.

questions.question: What is a bijective function?
questions.option_a: A. One-to-one only.
questions.option_b: B. Onto only.
questions.option_c: C. One-to-one and onto.
questions.explanation: A bijective function is both one-to-one and onto.

questions.question: What is the inverse of a function?
questions.option_a: A. A function that squares each output.
questions.option_b: B. A function that reverses the original mapping.
questions.option_c: C. A function that multiplies outputs.
questions.explanation: The inverse function reverses the mapping of the original function.

questions.question: Which of the following is not a type of function?
questions.option_a: A. One-to-one
questions.option_b: B. Onto
questions.option_c: C. Bijective
questions.explanation: Two-to-two is not a recognized type of function.

questions.question: Which of the following is true about a many-to-one function?
questions.option_a: A. One input maps to many outputs.
questions.option_b: B. Many inputs map to one output.
questions.option_c: C. Every input has a unique output.
questions.option_d: D. No input maps to output.
questions.explanation: In a many-to-one function, different inputs can result in the same output.

questions.question: Which function type is reversible?
questions.option_a: A. Injective
questions.option_b: B. Surjective
questions.option_c: C. Bijective
questions.explanation: Only bijective functions are reversible and have unique inverses.

questions.question: What is the domain of a function?
questions.option_a: A. Set of outputs.
questions.option_b: B. Set of inputs.
questions.option_c: C. All integers.
questions.explanation: The domain is the set of input values for which the function is defined.

questions.question: What does f(x) mean?
questions.option_a: A. An element of set x.
questions.option_b: B. Value of function f at input x.
questions.option_c: C. x multiplied by function f.
questions.explanation: f(x) denotes the output value of function f at input x.

questions.question: Which of the following always has 2^n elements?
questions.option_a: A. Power set
questions.option_b: B. Domain
questions.option_c: C. Codomain
questions.explanation: The power set of a set with n elements contains 2^n subsets.

questions.question: What is the main property of a function?
questions.option_a: A. One input has multiple outputs.
questions.option_b: B. Each input has exactly one output.
questions.option_c: C. Each output maps to one input.
questions.option_d: D. Domain and codomain are equal.
questions.explanation: A function maps each input to exactly one output.
